Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@dukeleto 
Just started to write some new tests for reward CC.  I wonder if we have to set some length check for reward plan name?
I saw your implementation for dice:
```#define PLAN_NAME_MAX   8
#define VALID_PLAN_NAME(x)  (strlen(x) <= PLAN_NAME_MAX)```

8 might be to small for this one since there is no description field. Is there some logic which making non reasonable names > 8 chars as in dice plans? (i'm sank in C code lol)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL that VALID_PLAN_NAME should go into a header file where all CC stuff can access it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL plan names are actually constrained to 8 chars, that data is stored in transactions as 1 byte, so it can't be larger

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL and I don't quite understand what you mean by ` Is there some logic which making non reasonable names > 8 chars as in dice plans?`

Author: TonyL#3577
dukeleto#7326
Content: token names are different than plan names

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: plan names, in all CC's, can be at most 8chars, because they are stored as 1 byte in op_return data

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: token names can be 32 chars and descriptions 4096 chars

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dukeleto  Thanks, so we have to set limitation for rewards plan as well.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is stored in sbits, uint64_t

Content:
@dukeleto I've added same validation for rewards CC (compiled and tested): https://github.com/tonymorony/komodo/commit/bad5d1c3bde49ab14d8436d040020ba340d147b3
If it's ok I'll add it to my next PR with rewards tests

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
implemented oracles CC (without validation yet) and still some bugs, but I have the rpc interface mostly done:
oraclesaddress [pubkey]
oraclescreate name description format
oraclesdata oracletxid hexstr
oraclesinfo oracletxid
oracleslist
oraclesregister oracletxid datafee
oraclessubscribe oracletxid publisher datafee

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I ended up using the oracle CC to allow people to create data subscription services

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
anybody can create a new oracle data description, and this txid is used for most of the other rpc calls.
given an oracletxid, a pubkey will register as a data provider with a datafee for each data post. I guess I need to allow a data provider to make a post without payment, so they can develop their own reputation.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given a data provider, anybody can then pay them to provide data for everybody else. this allows the data provider to post data and get paid the datafee per post. Likely this CC can support an entire data sub-economy, but there is no point to point data subscription that is directly supported. However, even this is possible by having the data that is posted being encrypted to the subscriber. in this case, you need to create a different oracletxid per subscriber

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this rpc interface is pretty much set, just might change due to bugs found. It will act as a data source for higher level CC, like prices and pegs CC
